intro: Relbunium asperum, commonly known as the rough relbunium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are rough and hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. Relbunium asperum produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
